div1.p: Carter informs Kean of Henry Rose Carter's dates of service in Cuba. [Courtesy of The Albert and Shirley Small Special Collections Library, University of Virginia Library]

div1.head: Letter from Laura Armistead Carter to Jefferson Randolph Kean, November 12, 1928
div1.opener:
In re Dr Henry R. Carter's visits to Havana
The Westmoreland,
Washington, D. C.
November 12, 1928.
Dear Colonel Kean:
div1.p:
Your very kind letter of November 7th. would have
been answered earlier but for a minor injury to my right hand.

In reply to your inquiry regarding the dates of Father's
service in Cuba, I would say that Father was ordered from New
Orleans to Havana in January 1899, reporting his arrival there on
February 1, 1899. He was absent from Cuba from June 1st. to
July 1st. 1899, having been recalled to New Orleans. Father
returned to Havana on July 1, 1899 and remained in Cuba until
September 1, 1899, when he was again recalled to the States
on account of the yellow fever epidemic in Key West, New Orleans
and Jackson, Mississippi.

Father returned to Havana in February 1900 and remained in
Cuba until July 23, 1900, when he was ordered back to the States
on account of ill health.

Thank you very much for your kind inquiries about the
progress of the work on Father's book. I know that you will be
glad to hear that Dr. Frost began the final editing of the MS
in September and that we are looking forward to its early com-
pletion. In the meantime life is pretty strenuous.
div1.closer:
With sincere appreciation of your interest, I remain
Very truly yours, Laura Armistead Carter Colonel Jefferson Randolph Kean,
Medical Corps, U. S., Army,
Army Medical Museum,
Washington, D. C.
The Military Surgeon.
Pl. note she afterwards mar-
ried Admiral E. R. Stitt Retired who
had been Surgeon General of the Navy.
She is now dead but he is still here.
